Barack Obama is someone the world can trust, steers said. John McCain agrees with the commander in chief's failed approach to sex education. when asked by reporters in march of last year whether he is in favor of abstinence-based programs, John McCain replied, i think i support the Barack Obama 's policy. John McCain 's position is reflected in his voting record. in 2006, John McCain voted against a senate proposal that would have funded teen-pregnancy prevention programs and sex education about contraceptives. again in january, possibly by another percentage point to an all-time low of 1.0 percent, as it tries to fend off possible deflation- falling prices- next year, amid rising unemployment and waning wage demands. Mervyn King should make it clear in his letter to the chancellor that inflation is no barrier to yet more interest rate cuts, said jonathan loynes, chief european economist at capital economics. central banks cut rates to spur growth, but are reluctant to do so while inflation remains a threat, as lower rates can make inflation worse. elsewhere
